value.title: Gov. Kemp blasts Kamala Harris' lies about Georgia voting law: 'Truth is on our side'
value.excerpt: Georgia Governor Brian Kemp defended his state's election laws after Vice President Kamala Harris announced a $25 million plan to combat Republican legislation on voting requirements.

value.title: Jill Biden travels the South to plead with hesitant Americans to get their Covid-19 vaccines
value.excerpt: First lady Jill Biden is back on the road, heading to parts of the country disenchanted, disaffected and -- perhaps -- disbelieving of the benefits of Covid-19 vaccines.

value.title: The Rebranding of ‘Trump Country’
value.excerpt: The population is fleeing, jobs are disappearing and coal really isn’t coming back. West Virginia’s boldest plan to reverse the slide is bribing white-collar workers to move from out of state.

value.title: White House helped form ethics agreement with art gallery that's selling Hunter Biden's paintings, sources say
value.excerpt: Hunter Biden's artistic debut is sparking ethics concerns for the White House as some critics raise eyebrows over the high-priced pieces and whether they pose a conflict of interest.

value.title: Trump Says Global Warming Efforts Don't Work Because 'Rest of the World' is 'Filthy'
value.excerpt: Trump blamed China and India for creating massive air pollution from coal plants while the U.S. focuses on "stupid" windmills that provide renewable energy.

value.title: Biden says ‘I will not send another generation of Americans to war in Afghanistan’ – live
value.excerpt: Joe Biden speaks on US troop withdrawal after 20 years at war – follow all the day’s political news

value.title: Kamala Harris joins DNC to announce expansion of "I Will Vote" campaign
value.excerpt: Vice President Harris on Thursday helped the Democratic National Committee announce an expansion of its "I Will Vote" campaign, which focuses on promoting voter registration and participation among minorities.

value.title: Mike Pence reportedly once 'lost it' after Trump threw a crumpled newspaper article at him
value.excerpt: Former Vice President Mike Pence reportedly "lost it" and "snarled" at former President Donald Trump in 2018 after getting a crumpled up newspaper article thrown at him. At the time, Pence's political committee had just hired Trump's adviser Corey Lewandowski,

value.title: Biden changes end of US combat mission in Afghanistan from Sept. 11 to Aug. 31
value.excerpt: President Biden said U.S. troops will be out of Afghanistan sooner than his original Sept. 11 deadline, telling reporters Thursday U.S. forces will be home by Aug. 31.

value.title: Trump CIA chief joins King & Spalding's bench of U.S. agency alums
value.excerpt: King & Spalding continues to build up its ranks of former federal government officials, announcing Thursday that it has added former U.S. Central Intelligence Agency director Gina Haspel to its national security team in Washington,

value.title: Kamala Harris’ stepdaughter Ella Emhoff makes Paris fashion week debut for Balenciaga
value.excerpt: Ella Emhoff made her inaugural appearance at Paris fashion week Wednesday, walking the runway for Balenciaga. The designer who mesmerized the fashion masses the day her stepmom Kamala Harris was sworn in as vice president modeled a flowing black cape over a chic double-breasted suit for a star-studded audience that included Joe Jonas,

value.title: Hannity: Biden called Georgia voter law 'Jim Crow' but here's the truth about his home state
value.excerpt: Sean Hannity, host of "Hannity," slammed President Joe Biden and the left for now supporting a push for voter ID laws. Hannity pointed out Wednesday that if Democrats want to be taken seriously, then Democrat-run states such as Delaware,

value.title: Lara Trump: CRT teaches us to 'judge people on the color of their skin'
value.excerpt: Fox News contributor Lara Trump joined “Fox & Friends” Thursday, suggesting that critical race theory is teaching children to “judge people on the color of their skin” and stating it’s “dead wrong.”

value.title: Fact Check-Photo does not show Biden kneeling before Israeli President ‘pledging support’
value.excerpt: A picture of U.S. President Joe Biden kneeling in front of outgoing Israeli President Reuven Rivlin and his chief of staff Rivka Ravitz has been mislabeled online. Some posts and articles have wrongly said he adopted the pose to “pledge unconditional support to

value.title: Trump got distracted by the word 'nuclear' during a bizarre press conference about his latest lawsuit
value.excerpt: "We don't use the word 'nuclear.' I never used it, okay? I never used it ... That's called disinformation," he said.

value.title: Biden to speak on Afghanistan amid US troop withdrawal and Taliban gains
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden will receive an update Thursday on the swiftly concluding war in Afghanistan, where a near-complete withdrawal of American troops is coinciding with major Taliban gains.

value.title: Mark Zuckerberg and Sheryl Sandberg’s Partnership Did Not Survive Trump
value.excerpt: The company they built is wildly successful. But her Washington wisdom didn’t hold up, and neither did their close working relationship.

value.title: Melania Trump Spotted In NYC Despite Efforts To Avoid Being Photographed
value.excerpt: Melania Trump was spotted in New York City for the first time since the Trumps left the White House in January.

value.title: Lobsters, cruises and scotch: One Cabinet secretary's push to sell Biden's agenda
value.excerpt: Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo won't hesitate to make the hard ask. She wants to make that clear.

value.title: Biden misquotes Reagan's 'Morning in America' ad while plugging infrastructure package
value.excerpt: President Biden misquoted one of former President Ronald Reagan’s most famous campaign ads during a Wednesday speech while promoting the potential economic benefits of his two-pronged spending plan on infrastructure and related projects.

value.title: Former aide to John McCain says he 'had such little respect' for Trump
value.excerpt: A former aide to Sen. John McCain says that the late Arizona Republican was unfazed by former President Trump's repeated insults because he didn't respect him.

value.title: Mo Brooks: 2020 election stolen from Donald Trump, ‘kick ass’ speech distorted
value.excerpt: Mo Brooks, in a sworn affidavit, said he still believes the 2020 presidential election was stolen from Donald Trump. In a federal court filing, Brooks also told the back story on his “kick ass” speech on Jan.

value.title: Trump says he's filing class action lawsuits against Facebook, Twitter and Google
value.excerpt: Former President Donald Trump is expected to announce class action lawsuits against Facebook and Twitter during a press conference this morning at his Bedminster, New Jersey, golf club, multiple sources familiar with the matter tell ABC News.

value.title: Former Trump official’s God-and-country nonprofit calls CRT a threat to ‘colorblind society’
value.excerpt: A former Trump administration official and Wheaton College graduate, Vought defines racism as “personal prejudice that flows from ignorance and treating people differently as a result of that prejudice.

value.title: First on CNN: Biden administration ramps up investment in environmental justice
value.excerpt: The Environmental Protection Agency announced Wednesday an additional $50 million in funding to enhance air pollution monitoring and improve air quality in low-income communities and communities of color.
